page.title: 01Alston Moor 03720546 South
page.content: Alston, situated in Pennines, is the highest market town in England. The part of the town in the south east corner of our D Block, known as Town Head, stands at 1000 feet above sea level, and contains the{Primary {School, the Police Station, Fairhill (recreation ground),{The Topp (multi-purpose building), the Council Yard and a number of{houses.} Along the A689 which runs from the south east corner in an easterly direction, are several more houses and a{factory that makes steel castings. This area is called Clitheroe. Further along the road is open farm land, all farms are{sheep farms}with some beef and dairy cattle. Most fields, which are enclosed with dry stone walls, are rough pasture with some hay. The scattered buildings consist of farmhouses and barns.
